name: Casa Bonita Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa Bonita was easily the best B&B we stayed in during our honeymoon trip. Clean, recently updated, friendly staff & owners, modern decor, fresh-feeling, great location - the reviews before me have really said it all. The owners have moved out due to having a child, and night staff only speaks Spanish, but that wasn't a problem - the owner provided an English letter to late-arriving guests with instructions and info. V. helpful. Breakfast was wonderful and included scrambled eggs and fresh juice.
reviews.title: A great find at a great price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the "new" shared bath bedrooms on the ground floor. While small (expected in S. America, so not a problem), they were high ceilinged and fresh. The bathrooms were gorgeous, with lovely showers. Didn't feel the need to wear flip-flops in the shower - everything was very clean. Our only problems with the room was that it was stuffy at night - we didn't feel comfortable leaving the windows open due to bugs & being on the ground floor (even though there were bars on the windows), and that the hall light shone in through the transom over the door all night long. At the end of our stay we requested a desktop fan, and that helped a little bit with the stuffiness, but not entirely.
reviews.title: Beautiful B&B in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite those minor problems, we whole-heartedly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Casa Bonita is the perfect location & place to stay while in Santiago.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this little hotel and the area it is in.
reviews.title: Charming small bed and breakfast
Top pick for Santiago
reviews.text: The B&B charming and done beautifully with attention to detail. Loved our room! The breakfast is good and the staff are wonderful - in fact, the best hotel staff we met in our 3 weeks across Chile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Casa Bonita on 8th March 2010, this was just a week after the earthquake and there were a couple cracks that were noticeable but the charm of this B&B shone through. There was no structural damage and I think by now that any sign of the earthquake will have disappeared as Dennis (the very helpful owner) was very keen to return to normal as soon as possible.
reviews.title: This is a superb B&B, clean, well designed and the owner very helpful. We would definitely go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The minimalist design along with the traditional wooden floors and hand picked pieces of furniture worked really well together. The bed itself was huge and very comfortable.
reviews.title: We loved this B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The light airy entrance hall, dining room and in fact all the areas in the B&B made this a fresh clean calm space amongst a busy city.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good luck Dennis and we hope to visit again sometime.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, and enjoyable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived shortly after the Feb. 27th earthquake! Casa Bonita survived the quake well with minor damage. Despite their own problems Dennis and Carolina emailed us to see if we were safe and to reassure us that our rooms were available. It was truly welcome news and we found our stay to be very pleasureable. The location was very convenient and it's proximity to the metro was great.
reviews.title: Simple, pleasant, and a great value for your money.

reviews.text: We have spent 3 nights in Casa Bonita, and it was a brilliant respite after 1,5 months travelling through all kinds of accommodations in Latin America. We felt like home, Dennis and Carolina were really nice and helpful. The place is beautiful, bright, spotlessly clean, quiet and relaxing. The shower is a 10 out of 10, a rare luxury. The breakfast is delicious, real, fresh orange juice and hot bread right out of the owen. We would definitely recomend it if you want a personal touch.
reviews.title: Home away from home in Santiago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Near one of the best restaurants in the city (Tiles). 100 meters from the subway. 200 meters from Salvadore Allende museum. In the middle of the University district, which if there is a criticism, is a problem when a student marching band goes by. This happened once in the three days we stayed at Casa Bonita. Dennis, the owner, was very helpful and friendly. The other staff did everything they could to make our stay pleasant.
reviews.title: What more could you ask?

reviews.text: Casa Bonita is much like Santiago itself - not sexy nor trendy, not the site of historic events, but solid and a place where everything works.
reviews.title: This is exceptionally good value and a delightful B and B

reviews.text: We stayed here for only one night and were so happy with the accommodation that we wished we could have stayed longer. A spacious room with lovely furnishings, comfortable beds and great linen. It's a handy location for airport transfers and public transport. The owners are very helpful and friendly. The best b and b breakfast we had in Chile and it included real coffee. It really is this good.
reviews.title: Fantastico! 5 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, best friend and I spent 10 fabulous days in Santiago and eight great nights at Casa Bonita. Dennis and Carolina and the rest of the staff could not have been kinder. The room was fabulous and spotlessly clean. The windows were amazing and the fresh air that swept through the room was delightful. My friend was pickpocketed and lost her Blackberry. But when someone contacted her to return it, Dennis and Monica went out of their way to assist her. The location is great and conveniece to metro can't be beat! Cozy bedding, great pillows, coffee and tea available 24/7. Great advise regarding area restaurants (go over to Av Brasil and Concha y Toro! Tales was wonderful and so close!) What can I say. It was wonderful!
reviews.title: Great choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In july we spend one night at Casa Bonita.
reviews.title: Search no further, this is the place to be!

reviews.text: The host, Dennis came to pick us up at the airport and was really helpfull. He and his wife gave us lots of information about sightseeiing in Santiago and the rest of Chile.
reviews.title: With my wife and our son, we stayed 8...

reviews.text: The B&B itself is very cosy and neat. We slept very wel (quiet street), the breakfast was very delicious and internet was available all day long. The B&B is also well located, just a minute from the subway and about 20 minutes by foot to the center!
reviews.title: Don't look further, this place is perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So if you're looking for a well located, cosy B&B where you can get a lot of help and information, this is the place to be!!
reviews.title: You will be happy that you stayed at Casa Bonita
The place to stay in Santiago
reviews.text: Karen and Dieter (Belgium)

description: Casa Bonita is an old house restored as a bed & breakfast. It is a National Monument located in a protected historical neighbourhood in the center of Santiago. Casa Bonita has a high historical value for Chile since it used to belong to the well known Vicaria de la Solidaridad del Arzobispado de Santiago, a foundation created in 1976 aiming to protect and defend human rights during the Military Regime. The Vicaria supported 984 cases and operated during the entire Military Regime. It closed in 1992. Casa Bonita offers a cosy environment with well furnished rooms, new and modern bathrooms, a comfortable living and dining room, a lovely interior garden and an internet room with free access. Casa Bonita is personally run by its owners (a Dutch-Chilean marriage) aiming to provide its guests with a quality service for a fair price. Due to its location and infrastructure, Casa Bonita is oriented to both tourists and business people.
